programs.name: Kindergarten
programs.description: The RKS uses a theme-based curriculum that is grounded on international standards, well-established early childhood educational philosophies, and a holistic multi-disciplinary approach.

programs.name: Basic Education Curriculum (BEC)
programs.description: Mathematics, English Language Arts, Science, Social Studies, Life Skills, Physical Education, Arts and Music, Information Technology, and Filipino as a Foreign Language.

programs.name: Advanced Placement (AP) Program
programs.description: Offers high school students college-level courses to prepare for top universities worldwide.

programs.name: Accountancy, Business Management (ABM)
programs.description: Students in the ABM strand take Strand Specific Subjects that concentrate on preparing students to major in business and entrepreneurship.

programs.name: General Academics (GAS)
programs.description: Students in General Academic Strand take a survey of strand specific subjects that allows students more flexibility in choosing a university degree.

programs.name: Humanities and Social Studies (HUMSS)
programs.description: Students in the HUMSS strand take Strand Specific Subjects in writing, anthropology, and philosophy.

programs.name: Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM)
programs.description: Students in the STEM strand take Strand Specific Subjects in the sciences, specifically in Biology, Chemistry, and Physics as well as higher Math such as Pre-Calculus and Calculus.

programs.name: Late Students Program
programs.description: Academic catch-up sessions for our students who come in 6 weeks after official classes have started.

programs.name: English as a Second Language (ESL)
programs.description: An academic supplementary program that meets the communicative needs for cognitive learning of second language learners whose English proficiency level falls below grade level.

requirements: Photocopy of Passport and Philippine VISA (for Foreign/Dual Citizen Applicants only)
Recent Developmental Pediatricians Report (for CIAP and PGLP applicants with diagnosis)
Certificate of Ranking per Section and per Batch (for incoming Gr. 10)
Certificate of Ranking per Strand and per Batch (for incoming Gr. 11 and 12)
documents: Photocopy of Passport and Philippine VISA (for Foreign/Dual Citizen Applicants only)
Recent Developmental Pediatricians Report (for CIAP and PGLP applicants with diagnosis)
Certificate of Ranking per Section and per Batch (for incoming Gr. 10)
Certificate of Ranking per Strand and per Batch (for incoming Gr. 11 and 12)

process_steps.description: Admissions Requirements: ACCOMPLISH Online Application Form, DOWNLOAD Application Form, DOWNLOAD Recommendation Form. Submit scanned copies of these requirements to ris@reedleyschool.com
Admissions Processing Fee: Kindly pay the Admissions Processing Fee directly at the bank. Contact us at (+63)917 507 9306 for our bank details.
Admissions Test & Screening: Schedule an admissions test with our Admissions Team.

scholarships.name: Sibling Discount
scholarships.eligibility: Two or more siblings enrolled in the school
scholarships.description: Discounts are available for families with multiple children enrolled.

contact.address: J. Cruz St., Barangay Ugong Pasig City, Metro Manila Philippines 1604
